title: Graph of deriv, semicircles and segments

content.question: Let f be a function defined on the closed interval −5 ≤ x ≤ 5 with f(1) = 3. The graph of f' the derivative of f, consists of two semicircles and two line segments, as shown above. (a) For -5 < x < 5, find all values x at which f has a relative maximum. Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Let f be a function defined on the closed interval −5 ≤ x ≤ 5 with f(1) = 3. The graph of f' the derivative of f, consists of two semicircles and two line segments, as shown above. (a) For -5 < x < 5, find all values x at which f has a relative maximum. Justify your answer.
(b) For -5 < x < 5, find all values x at which the graph of f has a point of inflection. Justify your answer.
(c) Find all intervals on which the graph of f is concave up and also has positive slope. Explain your reasoning.
(d) Find the absolute minimum value of f(x) over the closed interval −5 ≤ x ≤ 5. Explain your reasoning.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
